required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Adding Expiratory Muscle Strength Training in Voice Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Adding Expiratory Muscle Strength Training in Voice Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate if adding expiratory muscle strength training to traditional voice therapy for individuals with dysphonia due to glottal insufficiency improves maximal expiratory pressure, acoustic and aerodynamic measures (i.e. amplitude, maximum phonation time, peak expiratory flow), and voice related quality of life.

primary_outcome.description: Maximum expiratory pressure, in cm of H2O, will be measured to evaluate how much pressure a participant can blow into a respiratory pressure meter.
Amplitude of voice, in decibels, will be measured using handheld digital SPL meter values will be compared to gender matched normative values for normal and loud volumes.

secondary_outcome.description: Fundamental frequency, measured in herz, will be obtained using the Multidimensional Voice Profile on Kay Pentax Computerized Speech Lab.
Dynamic pitch range will be measured using Voice Range Profile on Kay Pentax Computerized Speech Lab.
Jitter, measured in relative average perturbation, will be obtained using the Multidimensional Voice Profile on Kay Pentax Computerized Speech Lab.
Shimmer, measured in decibels, will be obtained using the Multidimensional Voice Profile on Kay Pentax Computerized Speech Lab.
Noise to harmonic ratio, which is measured in a ratio, will be obtained using the Multidimensional Voice Profile on Kay Pentax Computerized Speech Lab.

This is quality of life assessment tool quantifying perception of the impact of their vocal disorder on various aspects of lifestyle. It is 30-questions in length and is divided into 3 subscales including emotional, physical, and functional, divided into 10 questions each. Each question scored from 0-4. Total score range from 0-120. Higher score indicates increased handicap.
The patient will be asked to inhale deeply and sustain the vowel /a/ at a comfortable loudness level for a many seconds as possible.
Peak expiratory flow rate, measured in units of liters per minute, will be measured for purposes of measuring cough function.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Unilateral vocal fold paralysis standard of care voice therapy
arm_group.description: The participants will receive the standard of voice therapy including improved breath coordination, sustained humming and vowels, vocal glides, resonant voice therapy, and relations techniques.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Unilateral paralysis standard of care voice therapy plus EMST
arm_group.description: The participants will receive the standard of voice therapy including improved breath coordination, sustained humming and vowels, vocal glides, resonant voice therapy, and relations techniques. EMST consists of blowing into respiratory device at a measure threshold pressure. As strength improves threshold resistance will be increased.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Parkinson's disease standard of care voice therapy plus EMST
arm_group.description: The participants will receive the standard of voice therapy including improved breath coordination, sustained humming and vowels, vocal glides, resonant voice therapy, and relations techniques. EMST consists of blowing into respiratory device at a measure threshold pressure. As strength improves threshold resistance will be increased.

intervention.description: Exercises will include improved breath coordination, sustained humming and vowels, vocal glides, resonant voice therapy, and relaxation techniques to the neck and shoulder
intervention.arm_group_label: Parkinson's disease standard of care voice therapy plus EMST
Unilateral paralysis standard of care voice therapy plus EMST
Unilateral vocal fold paralysis standard of care voice therapy

intervention.description: EMST150 used at 75% of their maximum expiratory pressure. Participants will be directed to perform 5 sets of 5 breaths, 5 days per week, for 5 weeks, at the pressure threshold established in therapy. Maximum expiratory pressure will then be determined at the beginning of each therapy session and recalibration of the device will be performed if indicated.
intervention.arm_group_label: Parkinson's disease standard of care voice therapy plus EMST
Unilateral paralysis standard of care voice therapy plus EMST

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals with glottic insufficiency.
- Adequate cognition evidenced by score of 24 or higher on the Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) survey to determine if the subject has the mental capacity to participate in therapy
- Completed voice combination evaluation with speech pathologists and otolaryngologist.
- Individuals 18 years of age or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Adults unable to consent
- Non English or Spanish speakers
- Pregnant women
- Prisoners
- Individuals with significant uncontrolled chronic and progressive respiratory diseases including COPD, interstitial lung disease, and cystic fibrosis.
- Individuals with uncontrolled blood pressure.
- Individuals with significant GI disease and/or gastroesophageal surgery with the exception of well-controlled GERD.
- Individuals with a history of abdominal hernia.
- Individuals with difficulty complying due to neuropsychological dysfunction (e.g., severe depression, psychosis).
- Individuals with other neurological disorders and/or neuromuscular disease other than Parkinson's Disease

overall_contact.last_name: Adam T Lloyd, MM, MA, CCC-SLP
